title: Robin's Plan to Join the Straw Hats
theory: Robin had been planning to join the Straw Hats since before the final confrontation with Crocodile. Evidence includes her giving them the Eternal Pose to Little Garden and her laughter at Luffy's declaration to Crocodile. She saw in Luffy someone who could protect her while she searched for the Rio Poneglyph.
author: Various One Piece Fans

title: Pell's Survival and Devil Fruit Regeneration
theory: Pell's survival from the bomb is explained by his Tori Tori no Mi (Bird-Bird Fruit) giving him enhanced durability and possibly some form of regenerative capability that allowed him to survive the explosion at high altitude where the blast was more dispersed.
author: One Piece Theory Community

title: Robin's True Goal and the Void Century
theory: Robin's mention of searching for the Rio Poneglyph for 20 years to uncover true history suggests she knows something catastrophic about the Void Century that drove her to spend her entire life running and searching. Her joining the Straw Hats is not just about survival but about finding a crew strong enough to reach the end of the Grand Line where the Rio Poneglyph might be located.
author: One Piece Lore Theorists

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: This theory connects to major revelations about the Void Century and Poneglyphs that occur much later in the series

title: Zoro's Suspicion as Character Development
theory: Zoro's continued suspicion of Robin, unlike the other crew members who quickly accept her, shows his role as the crew's unofficial first mate and protector. His wariness demonstrates that he takes threats to Luffy and the crew seriously, even when Luffy himself is trusting. This sets up his protective nature that becomes important in future arcs.
author: Character Analysis Community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Connects to Zoro's protective actions in later arcs
